intro: Arachnorchis viridescens, commonly known as the green spider orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to southeastern Australia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understoreys. The plant features a slender, leafless stem with a single, lance-shaped leaf. Its flowers are greenish-yellow with prominent dark veins, and they bloom from late winter to early spring. Arachnorchis viridescens is a rare and delicate species, often found in specific microhabitats.
